intro: Eriosema crassicaule, commonly known as the broad-stemmed eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and pod fruits. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are typically small and clustered. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
